From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To change the character padding on a specific output character for the current session, use the **terminalÂ padding** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: ASCII decimal representation of the character.
Number of NULL bytes sent after the specified character, up to 255 padding characters in length.

Examples: The following example pads Ctrl-D (ASCII decimal character 4) with 164 NULL bytes:
ExtraInfo: Character padding adds a number of null bytes to the end of the string and can be used to make a string an expected length for conformity.Use this command when the attached device is an old terminal that requires padding after certain characters (such as ones that scrolled or moved the carriage). See the"ASCII Character Set and Hexidecimal Values" appendix for a list of ASCII characters.

RelatedCmds.description: Sets the padding on a specific output character.
